availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jesse D. Winn (Fayette County, Kentucky, stock driver)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, stock driver. Kentucky native. Son of Mary Winn. Married to Lucy A. Buckner Winn. Father of Mary E. Winn, Catherine E. Winn, Benjamin S. Winn, William H. Win, George G. Winn, and Lucy A. Winn. Married to Margaret E. Darnaly Winn in Scott County, Kentucky, on October 17, 1851. Father to John Winn, Mary Winn, and Annie Winn. Resident in Fayette County in 1840. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1840. Farmer in Fayette County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Stock driver in Fayette County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 232B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 708.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 459.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 43B-44A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994033, Fayette County Deaths, p. 3.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Scott County Marriages, Film #000183225.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Frankfort, KY, File #20550.
